It contains appropriate supporting materials, such as an infobox, images, or diagrams. --> |B-Class-5=yes <!-- Task forces (general topics) --> |Weaponry= yes|US= yes|ACW= yes}}
There's a much more detailed discussion of the LeMat revolver under the heading LeMat: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LeMat
I suggest that merging what info is in this article with the other one. Besides, this one needs to be cleaned up. I don't think statements like "...that fired a .63 buckshot round that could blow a man's head off." are particularly informative...
I second that. not sure how to merge articles though... [[User:Hellfire83|Hellfire83]] 15:35, 6 February 2006 (UTC)
:I'll just remove the offending igorant statement for now :)--[[User:Stevekl|Stevekl]] 19:59, 26 July 2006 (UTC) I believe the only modern replica of this revolver comes from pietta. they began making them for Navy Arms and Cabelas in 1985. I do not believe Armi San Marco ever made one.--[[User:Cumpston|Cumpston]] 23:58, 15 August 2007 (UTC)
In the new video game, Red Dead Redemption, the player can purchase a LeMat Revolver from a store. It holds 9 rounds but has no buckshot option. It also seems to fire regular bullets like most late 19th century revolvers. --[[Special:Contributions/142.161.207.240|142.161.207.240]] ([[User talk:142.161.207.240|talk]]) 18:35, 25 May 2010 (UTC)
I am not a registered user, however I wanted to thank you guys for the inclusion and enthusiasm about the LeMat [[Special:Contributions/76.123.162.242|76.123.162.242]] ([[User talk:76.123.162.242|talk]]) 08:07, 10 October 2016 (UTC)
